etymology.description: 词(詞) (cí, "word; term") + 汇(彙) (huì, "collection; to collect") = a collection of words -> vocabulary
etymology.interpretation: 词汇(詞彙) (cíhuì, "vocabulary") refers to a collection or list of words, particularly those known or used by a person or within a particular language. It implies an organized collection of terms, essential for communication and language learning.

examples.chinese: 他每天学习词汇(他每天學習詞彙)，以扩充语言能力(以擴充語言能力)。
examples.pinyin: Tā měitiān xuéxí cíhuì, yǐ kuòchōng yǔyán nénglì.
examples.english: He studies vocabulary every day to expand his language ability.

examples.chinese: 词汇是语言的宝库(詞彙是語言的寶庫)。
examples.english: Vocabulary is the treasure house of language.
